steps.Step 1: Add tomatoes, garlic cloves, ginger, coriander stems, green chilli, Kashmiri or Degi red chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and soaked cashews to a mixer grinding jar. Do not add any water.
steps.Step 2: Blend all the ingredients in the mixer until they form a fine paste.
steps.Step 3: Heat 1 tbsp oil and 1 tbsp butter in a fry pan or wok. Add paneer cubes, salt, and a pinch of Kashmiri red chilli powder.
steps.Step 4: Toss the paneer gently for 1-2 minutes, until it holds its structure.
steps.Step 5: Transfer the tossed paneer to a bowl and set aside.
steps.Step 6: Heat 2 tbsp oil and 1 tbsp butter in the same wok.
steps.Step 7: Add cumin seeds, green cardamom, cinnamon stick, bay leaf, chopped garlic, and chopped green chilli, and stir.
steps.Step 8: Add chopped onions and sauté on medium high flame until they are light golden brown.
steps.Step 9: Add turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, and a splash of hot water. Cook the spices for 1-2 minutes.
steps.Step 10: Add the blended gravy paste, salt, and a pinch of sugar.
steps.Step 11: Cook the gravy on medium high flame for 10-15 minutes, stirring continuously.
steps.Step 12: Add hot water to adjust the consistency of the gravy.
steps.Step 13: Cook the gravy for an additional 2-3 minutes.
steps.Step 14: Add the sautéed paneer, butter, roasted kasuri methi powder, garam masala, fresh cream, and chopped coriander leaves to the gravy.
steps.Step 15: Stir gently to avoid crumbling the paneer and cook for 1-2 minutes.
steps.Step 16: Garnish with more chopped coriander leaves.

ingredients.Cashews: 15 (soaked for 15-20 minutes or boiled for 5 minutes)

transcript.text:
What's up guys? Sanjyot Keer here.
Welcome to YFL.
I'm making restaurant style or Dhaba style Paneer Butter Masala.

There have been a lot of requests for 
this recipe on comments & DMs.
So, I thought let me share an easy recipe with you all.
This is a really quick & easy recipe.

Paneer Butter Masala, no matter 
whichever Dhaba or restaurant you visit,
you can get quite a lot of varieties of it.
Usually in restaurants or dhabas, they make a lot of base gravies.

there's a makhani gravy, 
onion tomato masala or also known as chop masala.
So, these gravies are mixed in varied proportions & combinations, with a little spicy, a little sweet adjustments,

As you go to different places,
 the Paneer Butter Masala will keep changing.
& there may be some variations in it's recipes.
Now for Paneer Butter Masala, basically there should be paneer, butter & masala (spices) in it.
But if you make it in chop masala or bhuna masala, then it will become Paneer Bhuna.

It's gravy is orange or yellowish tinged.
 The one that I make is an orange gravy.

But the recipe that I'm showing today is a quick recipe.
 You don't need to make any gravy separately.
You don't need to make a lot of fuss or even do too much of chopping
By a simple & quick method Paneer Butter Masala will be ready

So, let's see how to make this recipe 
quickly without too much prep.
To a mixer grinding jar add 4 tomatoes,
I'm adding 2 tbsp of coriander stems here.
1.5 tbsp Kashmiri or Degi red chilli powder,

Here I've soaked 15 cashews for 15-20 minutes.
 You can boil them for 5 minutes too.
Remove the water & add the cashews.

Now, you have to blend all these ingredients nicely 
without adding any extra water to it.
You can see that I've blended it to a fine paste.

So here we have finished almost whole prep
 for Paneer Butter Masala.

No need to make any gravy. 
Just blended everything together in a mixer-grinder.

Didn't need to make ginger-garlic paste,
 or cashew paste or tomato puree separately.
We've blended everything together & our prep is done.
Now, we just need to toss the paneer,

& this gravy that we blended in the mixer grinder,
 we've to cook it with some onions.
& quickly the Paneer Butter Masala will be ready.
Let's see how to toss the Paneer.

Take a fry pan or a wok &
 add 1 tbsp oil & 1 tbsp butter & heat it up slightly.
Now, I've added 1/2 kg paneer cut into cubes here.
Add a little salt to taste,
& add a pinch of Kashmiri red chilli powder,
& mix the paneer with light hands or toss it like this.
so that the paneer does not crumble.

Cook the paneer for 1-2 minutes.
 By doing this step the paneer holds it's structure nicely.
I've tossed the paneer, now transfer it to a bowl.
& keep it aside until it's gravy is being made.

I'm using the same wok, & add 2 tbsp oil 
& 1 tbsp butter & let it heat up slightly.
Now to this add 1 tsp cumin seeds,
& add 1 chopped green chilli & stir it nicely.
Now, to this I've added 3 medium sized chopped onions.

You have to sauté these onions on medium high flame
 until they are light golden brown in colour.

Once the onions are light golden brown in colour, 
then lower the flame
& add 1/2 tsp Kashmiri red chilli powder for colour.

Stir it well. Then add a splash of hot water
 & cook the spices for 1-2 minutes.

Once you've cooked the spices, 
add the gravy that we had blended earlier.
& add a pinch of sugar to balance the tartness of the tomatoes.

Now, you have to cook this gravy on medium high flame
 while stirring for 10-15 minutes.

Since there is cashew paste in it, 
the gravy has a tendency to stick to the bottom.
You have to keep vigilant for just 10 minutes.
Cook the masala for 10-15 minutes on medium high flame while stirring,

Until the gravy leaves the sides of your pan
 & it starts releasing some oil from it.
You can see after 15 minutes, how the gravy has nicely thickened.
It's leaving the sides of the pan & the oil has released as well.
At this stage, add some hot water to adjust it's consistency.
Add hot water & stir well & cook this gravy for 2-3 minutes.

Once cooked, taste it for seasoning 
& adjust the salt & sugar as per taste.
Then add the sautéed paneer here.
a pinch of roasted kasuri methi powder,
& add some freshly chopped coriander leaves,
Now, here gently stir it to avoid the paneer from crumbling.
Just mix it lightly & cook it for 1-2 minutes.
Now, sprinkle some more freshly chopped coriander leaves on top.

& you can see that our Paneer Butter Masala is ready.
Let's plate it YFL style.
Did you see how easy it is to make this recipe?
We didn't do a lot of cutting-chopping.

I just chopped the onions, garlic & green chilli. 
Rest everything was blended in a mixer grinder.
& we didn't have to make any gravy or base separately.

Quickly, delicious Paneer Butter Masala, dhaba or
 restaurant style or you can call it YFL style, is ready.
& you can serve it with Naan, Roti or Rumali roti.

Whether you want to make Naan or Roti or Rumali roti, 
all the recipes are on YourFoodLab.
You can easily make it from there.

Definitely try this recipe & tell me in the comments
 how did you like this recipe.
Share this video with your friends & family.
Hit the Like button if you've liked this recipe.
Follow & Subscribe to YFL if you haven't yet.

Have an amazing time with this beautiful 
Paneer Butter Masala recipe at your home.

steps.Step 1: In a heated pan/wok, add some oil and ghee.
steps.Step 2: Add cut onions and fry until they turn translucent but not brown.
steps.Step 3: Add whole spices (black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf) and saute until aromatic.
steps.Step 4: Add ginger-garlic paste and saute until the raw smell goes away.
steps.Step 5: Add curd mixed with spices (coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, garam masala, turmeric powder).
steps.Step 6: Add cashew nuts and cook until they turn golden brown.
steps.Step 7: Add tomatoes and immediately add water to prevent the spices from sticking to the bottom of the pan.
steps.Step 8: Cover and let the gravy simmer for 15-20 minutes until the tomatoes are soft and the gravy thickens.
steps.Step 9: Add paneer cubes and let them cook in the gravy for 5-7 minutes.
steps.Step 10: Turn off the heat and add cream, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 11: Garnish with more dried fenugreek leaves and serve hot with paratha or rice.

ingredients.Whole spices: (black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf)

transcript.text: There were times, we used to start our recipes on tv by saying...
So, the basic premise.. For "Shahi Paneer",
the basic premise is that, you
make a gravy from onions, tomatoes and cashew nuts.
and we are making a gravy out of these.
I'll tell you a Fun Fact!
India's most favourite dish, "Shahi Paneer" is not actually Indian.
Well, how can it be Indian?
tomatoes were brought by Portuguese in India,
Cashew nuts were brought by Portuguese in India
and the concept of Paneer, the making of Paneer
was also brought by Portuguese to India.
bought the first cheese making, they bought tomatoes and they bought cashew nuts.
we just have to get rid of the rawness
Now there's a formula that i use all the time,
I add curd in it. Helps 2 ways, less cream is used,
and i add all the spices in the curd.
spices will not burn by mixing them
the natural ghee in the curd
spices will start sticking at the bottom.
So, add water immediately after adding the tomatoes.
In Shahi Paneer, the combination of onion and tomatoes,
is the base of Punjabi cuisine.
This combination of onion and tomatoes,
is the root of Punjabi cuisine.
They say, if you want to understand Punjabi cuisine,
understand the cooking process of tomatoes
or you could use it as it is.
Now this is Ranveer Brar's trick,
Whenever there is an onion tomato gravy,
during the tempering, for very little sweetness,
Sugar will caramalize, like it's melting here.
As the sugar melts in the oil,
Now what we have to do is,
Let it cook from inside, we"ll take it off the fire,
and like i said you don't need to add all the cream now, because
curd has given most of the texture of what a cream would give.
and dried fenugreek leaves to finish.
So the dried fenugreek leaves flavour needs to seep in.
So, your restaurant style "Shahi Paneer" is ready.
There goes dried fenugreek leaves for garnish.
Shahi Paneer in not complete without Paratha.
All you gotta do is just quickly go and make it, only takes 40 min.
Dhaba style Shahi Paneer you'll get.

steps.Step 1: Take some oil and ghee in a pan for heating.
steps.Step 2: Add sliced onions and saute till they are light brown.
steps.Step 3: Add whole spices like green cardamoms, black cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and bay leaf.
steps.Step 4: Add ginger-garlic paste and saute for a minute.
steps.Step 5: Add curd and mix in all the spices. Simmer for few mins.
steps.Step 6: Add cashew nuts and cook them.
steps.Step 7: Add chopped tomatoes and water. Let the spices cook.
steps.Step 8: Use butter for tempering and add sugar, chili powder, and tomato-onion gravy.
steps.Step 10: Let the paneer come to a boil and switch off the flame.
steps.Step 11: Add cream, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 12: Garnish with dried fenugreek leaves and serve with paratha.

steps.Step 1: Heat some oil and ghee in a pot.
steps.Step 2: Add the onions cut into quarters and saute until they begin to soften.
steps.Step 3: Add the whole spices (black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf) and stir.
steps.Step 4: Add ginger garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
steps.Step 5: In a separate bowl, mix curd with spices (turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, salt).
steps.Step 6: Add the curd mixture to the pot and stir continuously to prevent the spices from burning.
steps.Step 7: Add cashew nuts and cook for a few minutes until the spices are cooked.
steps.Step 8: Add tomatoes and immediately add water to prevent the spices from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
steps.Step 9: Let the gravy simmer for 10-15 minutes.
steps.Step 11: Heat butter in a pan and add sugar. Let the sugar caramelize.
steps.Step 12: Add chili powder and immediately add the strained gravy.
steps.Step 13: Add paneer and cook for a few minutes until it is heated through.
steps.Step 14: Add cream, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 15: Garnish with additional dried fenugreek leaves and serve with paratha.

ingredients.Whole spices: (black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf)

steps.Step 1: Gather the ingredients: onions, tomatoes, cashew nuts, cooking oil, ghee, spices (black and green cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf), ginger garlic paste, curd, water, butter, sugar, chili powder, paneer, cream, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 2: In a pan, heat oil and ghee.
steps.Step 3: Add whole spices and saute until fragrant.
steps.Step 4: Add chopped onions and cook until softened.
steps.Step 5: Add ginger garlic paste and cook for a minute.
steps.Step 6: Add curd mixed with all the spices and cook for a few minutes.
steps.Step 7: Add tomatoes and water to the pan.
steps.Step 8: Add cashew nuts and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
steps.Step 10: In a separate pan, heat butter and add sugar.
steps.Step 11: Once the sugar caramelizes, add chili powder and immediately add the strained gravy.
steps.Step 12: Add paneer and cook for a few minutes.
steps.Step 13: Turn off the heat and add cream, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 14: Serve hot with paratha or rice.

ingredients.Spices: Black and green cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf

steps.Step 1: In a large pot or pan over medium heat, add some oil and ghee.
steps.Step 2: Add chopped onions and fry until translucent but not browned.
steps.Step 3: Add whole spices such as black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, and bay leaves.
steps.Step 4: Add ginger garlic paste and stir-fry until the raw smell goes away.
steps.Step 6: Add cashew nuts and cook until fragrant.
steps.Step 7: Add chopped tomatoes and stir-fry until they soften.
steps.Step 8: Add water to prevent spices from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
steps.Step 11: In a separate pan, heat some oil and add sugar.
steps.Step 12: Add chili powder and immediately add the strained gravy.
steps.Step 13: Add paneer cubes and let them simmer until they absorb the flavors.
steps.Step 14: Add cream and season with garam masala, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 15: Serve hot with paratha or naan.

ingredients.Whole spices: 1 teaspoon each of black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, and bay leaves

steps.Step 2: Take whole spices, including black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, and bay leaf.
steps.Step 3: Add oil and ghee to a pan.
steps.Step 4: Add the chopped onions and whole spices to the pan and cook until the onions become translucent but not brown.
steps.Step 5: Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute, making sure not to let it burn.
steps.Step 6: Add curd and mix well. Add all the spices to the curd to prevent them from burning.
steps.Step 7: Cook the spices in the curd for a few minutes to allow them to slowly cook in the natural ghee present in the curd.
steps.Step 8: Once the spices are cooked, add cashew nuts and mix well.
steps.Step 9: Add tomatoes and water, and let the mixture come to a boil.
steps.Step 10: Once the mixture boils, immediately add butter and strain the gravy if desired.
steps.Step 11: Add paneer and let it cook in the gravy for a few minutes.
steps.Step 12: Turn off the heat and add cream. Adjust the consistency of the gravy by adding more water or cream as needed.
steps.Step 13: Add green cardamom powder and dried fenugreek leaves for flavor.
steps.Step 14: Serve Shahi Paneer with paratha or naan.

ingredients.Whole spices: black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf

steps.Step 1: Gather the ingredients: onions, tomatoes, cashew nuts, whole spices (black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, and bay leaf), ginger-garlic paste, curd, Paneer, butter, sugar, chilli powder, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 2: Heat some oil and ghee in a pan.
steps.Step 3: Add the whole spices and fry until aromatic.
steps.Step 4: Add the onions and cook until softened but not browned.
steps.Step 5: Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
steps.Step 6: Add the curd and mix well.
steps.Step 7: Add the tomatoes and cook until they soften.
steps.Step 8: Add water to prevent the spices from sticking and cook for a few minutes.
steps.Step 11: Add sugar to the oil and let it caramelize.
steps.Step 12: Add the chilli powder and immediately add the gravy.
steps.Step 13: Add the Paneer and cook for a few minutes.
steps.Step 14: Season with salt and garam masala.
steps.Step 15: Add the cream and mix well.
steps.Step 16: Garnish with green cardamom powder and dried fenugreek leaves.

ingredients.Whole spices: black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, and bay leaf

steps.Step 1: Put chopped tomatoes in a pan.
steps.Step 2: Add roughly diced onions to the pan, ensuring the ratio of tomatoes to onions is 2:1.
steps.Step 3: Cut quartered onions to ensure they cook faster.
steps.Step 4: Add cashew nuts, garlic, ginger, green chili, bay leaf, cardamom, cinnamon, black cardamom, cloves, Kashmiri chili powder, salt, and butter to the pan.
steps.Step 6: Cover the pan and cook for 20 minutes.
steps.Step 7: Cool the mixture slightly and puree it until smooth.
steps.Step 8: Strain the curry to remove any solids.
steps.Step 9: In a fresh pan, melt butter and add chopped ginger and green chili.
steps.Step 10: Add cottage cheese and salt, and stir lightly.
steps.Step 11: Add the strained curry and stir gently to avoid breaking the cheese.
steps.Step 12: Add fenugreek leaves powder, mace powder, cardamom powder, and cream.
steps.Step 13: Garnish with fresh coriander sprigs and serve with Roti or Parantha.

steps.Step 1: In a pan, heat oil and ghee.
steps.Step 2: Add onions cut into quarters and fry until translucent.
steps.Step 3: Add whole spices such as black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, and bay leaf.
steps.Step 4: Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
steps.Step 7: Add tomatoes and immediately add water to prevent the spices from sticking.
steps.Step 9: Strain the gravy or use as it is.
steps.Step 10: In a separate pan, heat oil and add sugar.
steps.Step 11: As the sugar melts, add chili powder and immediately add the gravy.
steps.Step 12: Add paneer and let it cook until tender.
steps.Step 13: Add cream, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.

steps.Step 1: Gather the necessary ingredients for the Shahi Paneer recipe: onions, tomatoes, cashew nuts, whole spices (black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf), ginger garlic paste, curd, sugar, chilli powder, Paneer, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 2: Heat some oil and ghee in a pan. Add the onions cut into quarters and whole spices.
steps.Step 3: Sauté the onions until they become translucent and not brown.
steps.Step 4: Add ginger garlic paste and stir.
steps.Step 5: Add curd mixed with spices to the pan. This helps reduce the usage of cream and prevents the spices from burning.
steps.Step 6: Add cashew nuts and cook until the mixture becomes aromatic.
steps.Step 7: Add tomatoes and immediately add water to prevent the spices from sticking to the bottom of the pan.
steps.Step 8: Simmer the gravy until the tomatoes are cooked.
steps.Step 10: For tempering, add sugar to the oil and let it caramelize. Add chilli powder and immediately add the gravy.
steps.Step 11: Add Paneer and let it cook for a few minutes.
steps.Step 12: Turn off the heat and add cream, green cardamom powder, and dried fenugreek leaves.
steps.Step 13: Garnish with more dried fenugreek leaves. Serve hot with Paratha.

ingredients.Whole spices: black and green cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon, cumin seeds, bay leaf (amounts not specified)
